title: Spoofing - HTTP Login Hijacking
description: HTTP traffic hijacked - JWT captured from login response and used to impersonate user
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS. Reject all HTTP requests.

title: Spoofing - JWT Replay Attack
description: JWT Bearer token sent over HTTP - captured from network and replayed to impersonate user
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS. Add JWT expiration and refresh tokens.

title: Spoofing - MongoDB No Authentication
description: MongoDB connection without authentication - anyone on network can connect directly
mitigation: Enable MongoDB authentication with strong passwords. Use TLS for connections.

title: Spoofing - XSS JWT Theft
description: XSS attack steals JWT from localStorage - attacker impersonates user indefinitely
mitigation: Use httpOnly cookies instead of localStorage. Implement CSP headers. Add JWT expiration.

title: Tampering - Login Request Modification
description: No TLS allows attacker to modify login request/response in transit
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS everywhere. Use HSTS headers.

title: Tampering - Secret Data Interception
description: Secret data intercepted and modified in transit over HTTP
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS. Consider end-to-end encryption for secretValue field.

title: Tampering - MongoDB Wire Protocol
description: MongoDB wire protocol unencrypted - attacker can see and modify queries including plaintext secrets
mitigation: Use TLS for MongoDB connection. Enable wire protocol encryption.

title: Tampering - Response Injection
description: HTTP allows response tampering - attacker could inject malicious secrets into API responses
mitigation: Implement HTTPS. Add response integrity checks.

title: Tampering - Query Result Modification
description: Unencrypted MongoDB connection allows intercepting and modifying query results
mitigation: Use TLS for MongoDB connection.

title: Tampering - localStorage Modification
description: Malicious browser extension can modify JWT in localStorage
mitigation: Use httpOnly + Secure + SameSite cookie flags instead of localStorage.

title: Repudiation - No Auth Logging
description: No logging of authentication attempts - user can deny login activity or attacker attempts passwords undetected
mitigation: Log all authentication attempts with timestamp

title: Repudiation - No Secret Access Audit
description: No audit trail of which secrets were accessed or when - users can access secrets and deny it
mitigation: Log every secret access (view

title: Repudiation - No Database Audit Log
description: No database audit logging - attacker can modify data and no record exists
mitigation: Enable MongoDB audit logging for all operations.

title: Repudiation - No Response Logging
description: No logging of what data was sent to users - cannot prove what information was disclosed
mitigation: Log all API responses including which secrets were returned to which user.

title: Information Disclosure - Plaintext Password
description: Password sent in plaintext over HTTP - any network sniffer can read credentials
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS immediately.

title: Information Disclosure - Plaintext Secrets Transit
description: All secrets transmitted in plaintext JSON over HTTP - production API keys and passwords exposed
mitigation: Implement HTTPS/TLS. Consider end-to-end encryption for sensitive fields.

title: Information Disclosure - Plaintext Secrets DB
description: All secrets flow from MongoDB to API in plaintext - complete exposure if database compromised
mitigation: Encrypt secrets at rest in MongoDB using AES-256-GCM.

title: Information Disclosure - DB Credentials Exposed
description: Database credentials in environment variables - if leaked attacker has full database access
mitigation: Store connection string in secrets manager (AWS Secrets Manager

title: Information Disclosure - Browser Cache
description: Browser caches responses - secrets may persist in browser cache or history
mitigation: Set Cache-Control: no-store headers. Never put secrets in URL parameters.

title: Information Disclosure - JWT in DevTools
description: JWT visible in DevTools - JWT payload is base64-encoded not encrypted
mitigation: Use httpOnly cookies. Minimize JWT payload data. Remove sensitive info from JWT.

title: Denial of Service - Login Flooding
description: No rate limiting on login endpoint - attacker can flood with requests to exhaust server resources
mitigation: Implement rate limiting (e.g. 5 attempts per 15 min per IP). Add CAPTCHA after failures.

title: Denial of Service - API Flooding
description: No pagination or rate limiting on GET /api/items - attacker requests all secrets repeatedly
mitigation: Implement pagination for GET requests. Add rate limiting per user (e.g. 100 req/min).

title: Denial of Service - Connection Exhaustion
description: No connection pooling limits - attacker can exhaust database connections
mitigation: Configure MongoDB connection pool limits. Implement connection timeouts.

title: Elevation of Privilege - Direct DB Access
description: Direct database access bypasses API authorization - attacker modifies user roles or grants access to any secret
mitigation: Enable MongoDB authentication. Minimize database user privileges. Use separate read-only and read-write users.
